subject: Boxing
Deaths (Obituaries)
lead_paragraph: The Mexican featherweight Daniel Aguillon died after a five-day coma induced by a knockout blow, his family said. Alejandro Sanabria, another Mexican, knocked out Aguillon, 24, last Wednesday, 40 seconds before the end of a Central American featherweight title fight. Doctors operated to treat a blood clot in Aguillon’s brain, but he did not regain consciousness. He was 16-2-4 in his career, with 9 knockouts.
